728320f-a.title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Huguenot Avenue
728320f-a.text:
Memorial Church of the Huguenots.
This photograph taken while the church was under
construction, sometiwe prior to its 1924 dedication.

728968f-a.title: Richmond: Huguenot Avenue - Amboy Road
728968f-a.text:
885 Huguenot Avenue, east side, north of Amboy Road, showing
the Huguenot Station of the United States Post Office.
1924
P. L. Sperr
728968f-a.folder: Huguenot Avenue & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY

728321f-b.title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Huguenot Avenue
728321f-b.text:
(1)
Amboy Road, west of the N.W. corner of Huguenot Ave., showing
the Eugcenot Park Reformed Church. It was dedicated on May 16,
1924, as a National monument to the Huguenot settlers of America.
For additional information see Staten Island and its People by Leng
and Davis, vol. 1, p 442.
September 24, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view of the church, looking eastward.
September 24, 1930.
P. L. S9err.
728321f-b.folder: Amboy Road & Huguenot Avenue, Staten Island, NY

728969f-a.title: Richmond: Huguenot Avenue - Amboy Road
